intro: Diploglottis harpullioides, commonly known as the broad-leaved diploglottis, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It is a shrub or small tree that can reach heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
